title: How much people use scripts?
body:
I was watching those boxbox vs brna mirror urf 1v1s and they were talking about how they were using scripts on leblanc for perfect W's...so I searched it up o.o OP...and yeah, now that I think of it, I might have played with some people who were (obviously) scripting.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=o1iM_35NP44

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FfyLlmSUibY

Not sure if you can counter scripters by predicting their scripts

replies.body:
"_I might have played with some people who were (obviously) scripting._"
Clearly not as you had no idea they existed, for about two years Riot had no Anti-Cheat, which allowed a script community to form and begin, Riot didn't do much, or say much as the script community got bigger and bigger, it went from one client to about 5. Despite scripters even appearing in games Riot were in they assumed it was skill, yes... skill. 

That bronzeV person was now able to kite with challenger mechanics, yet still stuck in bronze due to their awful knowledge of the game. It took Riot about 3 years to finally do something and they did a few ban waves, but we all know the people coding the script client s are smarter than the people making the anti-cheat.
Not many. I've played for 3.5 years and I've only seen 2 or 3 obvious scripters.

> [{quoted}](name=Lord Kylar Alice,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=i7K8giY3,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2015-04-14T01:10:11.022+0000)
>
> Not many. I've played for 3.5 years and I've only seen 2 or 3 obvious scripters.

I've seen more botters that scripters - I think scripting is pretty easy to spot and pretty easy to identify at rito's end.

But man, ARAM is just bot city now. it is not fun to play. Suspect as the population declines and the BE grind is more onerous, more bots will appear.

I've seen a few but not a huge volume.

Even saw a yi jg bot once. That was tragic.
those are scripter answers, To give you and idea, there were recorded over 40,000 scripters on Korean severs, but NA I think I get a game with one every 20 or so

> [{quoted}](name=Diablö,realm=NA,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=i7K8giY3,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2017-11-13T00:18:39.692+0000)
>
> those are scripter answers, To give you and idea, there were recorded over 40,000 scripters on Korean severs, but NA I think I get a game with one every 20 or so

daaaayamn I had no idea it was so many in korea. Honestly oz has them but not that many. Maybe the smaller game population gives bots fewer places to hide and they are called out very quickly. Also, there is a distinction between a scripter and a bot - scripters use third party programs to pull off combos perfectly every time. Bots just farm ip by pure volume and dgaf if they win or lose.
pretty sure i saw a cass yesterday script but its really not very common.
Cass is one of the most known champions to excel with scripts, it's rare to see one but a scripting Cass isn't out of the ordinary.

Those are both some pretty obvious examples, tbh I didn't even know you could do this until recently. Never seen/noticed it in matches I've played. Can anyone give me a rundown of how it works? Thought LoL was all server side, so less/no cheating.

Leonorn is a jinx scripter, me and my duo were bot against him, never landed any skill shot, he got every cs near him even during trades he cs, and he moving to dodge the second a skill shot would leave fog of war

Stop worrying about scripts and worry about your own gameplay. There's a line between if someone is good at the game, and can predict your shit, or someone who is actually scripting. Keep in mind that scripting doesn't completely make them invincible.
